entries.title: Elrond
text: Strangers from distant lands, friends of old.
You have been summoned here to answer the threat of Mordor.
Middle-Earth stands upon the brink of destruction.
None can escape it.

entries.title: Elrond
text: You will unite or you will fall. Each race is bound to this fate--this one doom.
Bring forth the Ring, Frodo.

entries.title: Boromir
text: So it is true...

entries.title: Man of Laketown
text: The Doom of Men!

entries.title: Borimir
text: It is a gift.
A gift to the foes of Mordor.
Why not use this Ring? Long has my father, the Steward of Gondor, kept the forces of Mordor at bay.

entries.title: Borimir
text: By the blood of our people are your lands kept safe!
Give Gondor the weapon of the enemy.
Let us use it against him!

entries.title: Aragorn
text: You cannot wield it! None of us can. The One Ring answers to Sauron alone.
It has no other master.

entries.title: Borimir
text: And what would a ranger know of this matter?

entries.title: Legolas
text: This is no mere ranger.
He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn.
You owe him your allegiance.

entries.title: Borimir
text: Aragorn? This... is Isildur's heir?
